item.title: The Lively Morgue
item.description: After lots of effort & care, @heenako, @kerrimac, @nicatnyt, Darcy Eveleigh & I have a new NYT Tumblr to share: http://t.co/R36jCdMU
item.content:encoded: After lots of effort & care, @heenako, @kerrimac, @nicatnyt, Darcy Eveleigh & I have a new NYT Tumblr to share: http://t.co/R36jCdMU Jan. 9, 1930: “The latest thing in speakeasies: Sergeant Frank T. Zimmie and Detective Joseph Pallinado of the Philadelphia Police, exhibiting one of the twelve pint bottles of liquor cached in the papier-mâché clothes dummy, draped with an evening gown, found in the tailor shop they raided.” Two days later, The Times published an article about claims of a “police protected” speakeasy made at a luncheon of the Women’s Organization for Prohibition Reform in Philadelphia. Photo: The New York Times * black and white * nytimes * vintage * photography * 1930s Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: tumblr.com

item.content:encoded: IPhone's Crutch of Subsidies: The iPhone's relatively low market share in countries such as Greece and Portugal,... http://t.co/Fa2VHDHn The iPhone's relatively low market share in countries such as Greece and Portugal, which have been hit hard by the European debt crisis, point to a rare weak spot for Apple—its heavy reliance on subsidies from wireless carriers to make the device affordable to a wider range of consumers. item.title: Attorney Says Pinterest Needs To Change It Digital Copyright Policy
item.description: Attorney Says Pinterest Needs To Change It Digital Copyright Policy http://t.co/PS30ghpO
item.content:encoded: Attorney Says Pinterest Needs To Change It Digital Copyright Policy http://t.co/PS30ghpO Questions continue to mount about Pinterest's uneasy relationship with copyright law, with one attorney (and avid Pinterest user) saying the company needs to upgrade its Digital Millenium Copyright Act policies or risk being shut down. Connie Mableson, an attorney in Phoenix, offers a point-by-point breakdown of where Pinterest's DMCA policy could get the increasingly popular social network into trouble. The problems range from simple clerical errors, like forgetting to update its registered designated agent as required by the act, to more serious problems, like failing to include "repeat infringer" language in the policy as required by federal digital copyright law.... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

Yet, if we look at all people using Social Media for just 60 seconds, the amount of messages being sent is quite Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Is There Ever A Justification For Responsive Text? | Smashing Magazine
item.description: New on SmashingMag: Is There Ever A Justification For Responsive Text? - http://t.co/QEpXgZ08
item.content:encoded: New on SmashingMag: Is There Ever A Justification For Responsive Text? - http://t.co/QEpXgZ08 Depending on who you follow and what you read, you may have noticed the concept of “responsive text” being discussed in design circles recently. It’s not what you might imagine — resizing and altering the typography to make it easier to read on a range of devices — but rather delivering varying amounts of content to devices based on screen size. One example of this is an experiment by designer Frankie Roberto. Another is the navigation menu on the website for Sifter App. Roberto and Sifter are using media queries to actually hide and display text based on screen size (i.e. not rewriting or delivering different content based on context — as one would do with mobile-focused copy, for example). Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: smashingmagazine.com

item.content:encoded: No Company Follows Apple Allowing Expanded China Audits Amid Abuses: Tech: No Company Follows Apple Allowing Ex... http://t.co/gGhluPsj Apple Inc.’s rivals aren’t rushing to emulate the iPhone maker’s decision to subject supplier factories to audits by a labor group. item.title: Nicholas Felton | Feltron.com
item.description: Hot off the presses! 2011 @feltron annual report is out: http://t.co/aqDJ6Jcq
item.content:encoded: Hot off the presses! 2011 @feltron annual report is out: http://t.co/aqDJ6Jcq Please visit the shop to order print editions of the 2010/2011 report. Philip K. Dick claimed that “a person’s authentic nature is a series of shifting, variegated planes that establish themselves as he relates to different people; it is created by and appears within the framework of his interpersonal relationships.” The Feltron 2010/2011 Biennial Report explores this notion by overlapping facets of Nicholas’ behavior to visualize how his personality varies based on location and company. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: feltron.com
